pr_title: Decouple server instance id with hostname/port config.

timeline.message: Decouple server instance id and hostname/port config.

timeline.bodyText: Following code looks like its repeated in every test. Consider refactoring ?
timeline.author: icefury71

replies.bodyText: Code refactored to remove duplicate codes.
replies.author: chenboat

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this ? I think we will always use the Zk info to look up host and port (whether logical id is enabled or not).
timeline.author: icefury71

replies.bodyText: This config flag is used only for server start and  mainly used for backward compatibility. It controls if we want to overwrite the host/port info in zk using those found server config. The current behavior is to extract hostname from instance id if instance id is found in server config. We do not want to break these use cases for now.
replies.author: chenboat

timeline.bodyText: You could also simply look up if the server config has instance id set ?
timeline.author: icefury71

timeline.message: Fix a test failure due to using local ip address. Refactor tests.
Fix a test failure due to using local ip address.
Fix test failure due to hostname.
Remove config flags about instance id overwrite.

timeline.bodyText: Can you combine this with addInstanceTagIfNeeded() as both of them need to access the InstanceConfig to reduce the overhead?
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.message: Add more log for server config udpates.

timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: _helixAdmin.addInstanceTag() writes to zk. InstanceTag.add() does not do that -- instanceTag is merely a reference. I do not think the former can be simplified to latter. Did I miss anything here?
replies.author: chenboat

replies.bodyText: That is why I suggested adding a flag to track whether we need to update and write the instance config back to ZK. Each _helixAdmin.addInstanceTag() reads the instance config and writes it back, which can be saved with the flag. Overall we should only read the instance config once, and write it back once if it needs to be updated.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Add a boolean flag to track whether the instance config needs to be updated
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText:
What is the use of a boolean flag here? We have to read from the zk anyway because to update tags needs to the current number of tags. As for writing to zk, the current boolean conditions already check for cases we do not need to write to zk.
There could be an optimization to combine two zk writes into one -- but there seems to be many logics specific to instance tag update already. I wonder if it is worthwhile to do this optimization. Instance updates to zk are start only events and the performance impact here should be fine, right?
replies.author: chenboat

timeline.bodyText: Don't use System.exit() for production code. Throwing an exception is good enough to abort
timeline.author: Jackie-Jiang
Jackie-Jiang

timeline.message: Port is an integer in the config.
Port is an integer in the config.
